### [amoeba](#amoeba){#amoeba}


#### Definition
an identifiable organism that is an ameboid protist with a test and that belongs to the kingdom Protozoa. Traditionally, those species that form large networks of anastomosing pseudopodia, despite of some of them having tests e.g. Foraminifera, are not counted amongst testate amoebae (Credit: Wikipedia).


*source: PaST*

### [charcoal](#charcoal){#charcoal}


#### Definition
a bulk biological material that consists of any black-colored plant-derived material that has had its chemical composition and structure altered as a result of heating in a fire, and retains recognizable anatomic structure of the plant material, even if only in a fragmentary form (Credit: Smol et al. 2001 Tracking Environmental Change Using Lake Sediments).


*source: PaST*


#### Known synonyms



#### NOAA PaST Thesaurus term
[<font size="4">charcoal</font>](https://www.ncei.noaa.gov/access/paleo-search/cvterms?termId=630) (https://www.ncei.noaa.gov/access/paleo-search/cvterms?termId=630)


---

### [d13C](#d13C){#d13C}


#### Definition
the ratio of two isotopes of carbon, 13C/12C, in a sample compared to that of a standard, typically the Pee Dee Belemnite, as in: ((13C/12C sample)/(13C/12C standard) - 1) x 1000.


*source: PaST*


#### Known synonyms
d13Cwax


#### NOAA PaST Thesaurus term
[<font size="4">delta 13C</font>](https://www.ncei.noaa.gov/access/paleo-search/cvterms?termId=320) (https://www.ncei.noaa.gov/access/paleo-search/cvterms?termId=320)


---



### [d15N](#d15N){#d15N}


#### Definition
the ratio of two isotopes of nitrogen, 15N/14N, in a sample compared to that of a standard, typically modern air ratios, as in: ((15N/14N sample)/(15N/14N standard) - 1) x 1000.


*source: PaST*


#### Known synonyms



#### NOAA PaST Thesaurus term
[<font size="4">delta 15N</font>](https://www.ncei.noaa.gov/access/paleo-search/cvterms?termId=322) (https://www.ncei.noaa.gov/access/paleo-search/cvterms?termId=322)

### [d18O](#d18O){#d18O}


#### Definition
the ratio of two isotopes of oxygen, 18O/16O, in a sample compared to that of a standard, typically either Pee Dee Belemnite or standard mean ocean water, as in: ((18O/16O sample)/(18O/16O standard) - 1) x 1000.


*source: PaST*


#### Known synonyms
cellulose d18O, delta18O, foram d18O


#### NOAA PaST Thesaurus term
[<font size="4">delta 18O</font>](https://www.ncei.noaa.gov/access/paleo-search/cvterms?termId=323) (https://www.ncei.noaa.gov/access/paleo-search/cvterms?termId=323)


---



### [dD](#dD){#dD}


#### Definition
the ratio of two isotopes of hydrogen, 2H/1H, in a sample compared to that of a standard, typically standard mean ocean water, as in: ((2H/1H sample)/(2H/1H standard) - 1) x 1000.


*source: PaST*


#### Known synonyms
d2H, dDwax, leaf wax, LeafWax, leafWax


#### NOAA PaST Thesaurus term
[<font size="4">delta 2H</font>](https://www.ncei.noaa.gov/access/paleo-search/cvterms?termId=324) (https://www.ncei.noaa.gov/access/paleo-search/cvterms?termId=324)


---



### [deuterium excess](#deuterium_excess){#deuterium_excess}

### [IP25](#IP25){#IP25}
